To lift the country out of the famine, all the major “new-born” institutions of
the GreatLeapwere abolished by the end of1961.Thelarge,semi-communist
rural communes, the public dining halls, the militarized rural workforce, the
urban People's Communes and the backyard steel furnaces all disappeared.
